item.title: Eight Years In Switzerland
item.description:
Eight years ago today we moved to Switzerland. Once again it's time to take stock and reflect on the previous year.

(Previous posts after one, three, four, five, six, and seven years in Switzerland.)


The Past Year


Work

I continue to enjoy working remotely for PassiveLogic. I've transitioned from working on iOS to writing cross-platform (non-UI) frameworks in Swift. I've traveled once to Salt Lake City, Utah and twice to Amsterdam to visit the offices there.


Learning German

Honestly I've not made much progress with my German. I participated in a discussion class last Fall, but so far in 2025 I've not formally studied. However, for the Fall I've signed up for two in-person classes and an online test prep course, and I've already registered for Goethe B2 Listening and Speaking tests in November. I will need the B2 tests in order to be eligible to apply for Swiss citizenship.


Integration

I've made some progress this year. I continue to meet up in Z√ºrich roughly monthly to play D&D with a group of Swiss friends (and I continue to run an online D&D campaign for a mostly different set of Swiss friends). Swiss RPG holds monthly get-togethers in Z√ºrich, and I make an effort to attend those. Last month I even attended the first ever Zug get-together and met some folks closer to home (I hope to start playing more locally). I've run D&D games at Z√ºrich PopCon and FaBa

Last August I particpated in a local lake cleanup, which was good fun. The group of about 20 volunteers spent four hours removing trash from Lake √Ñgeri, and then we had a sunset cookout by the lake.

In February I was invited to a fondue dinner / board game evening, which was amazing.

Outside of the RPG group though, I struggle to make connections.


Travel

Apart from three business trips, I traveled to the UK to visit Cambridge with my son and domestically I've made a couple trips to Graubunden.


Nature / Outdoors

I continue to hike year-round, snowshoe in the winter, and standup paddle in the summer.

I've been much more active in 2025 than I was in the previous year. In the first six months of 2025, I've already exercised outdoors more days and hiked farther than I did in all of 2024.

I spent two nights up at the Berggasthaus Wildspitz (and have another night booked in two weeks). I hiked the first four stages of the Via Engiadina six weeks ago, and today I head out to hike the remaining eight stages.


Last Year's Goals

How did I do on last year's goals?


Hits

  • Hike more stages of the Via Engiadina
  • Spend a night in a mountain hut
  • Exercise regularly
  • Enroll our son in university

Indeterminate

  • Make plans for beyond summer 2025

Misses

  • Improve my conversational German

Goals for our ninth year in Switzerland

  • Spend a night in a new mountain hut
  • Exercise regularly
  • Pass the B2 Goethe German Listening and Speaking tests
  • Improve my conversational German
  • Make more concrete plans for the future

The Future

Our son starts university in the UK in September. I'm not ready to be an empty-nester!

That said, my plan is to stay right where we're at and eventually apply for my Swiss citizenship.

item.title: Fantasy Basel 2025 x D&D x LEGO
item.description:
On the final weekend of May I combined my love for LEGO and D&D when I attended the Fantasy Basel convention and ran four two-hour D&D games using a LEGO set as a battle map and LEGO minifigures as the miniatures. (This was part of a volunteer effort by Swiss RPG that ran 63 two-hour games for 315 attendees over three days.) Everyone seemed to have a good time, so yay!

I went into this not knowing whether this was a terrible idea or not, but the published one-shot worked pretty well for a 2-hour conference setting and every time the group was able to at least reach the final encounter with the evil sorcerer and the dragon within two hours. I definitely improved at running it with each play-through. I think I might try to run it again at HeroFest in Bern and/or Z√ºrich Pop Con in the Fall.

item.title: Via Engiadina Plans
item.description:
The Via Engiadina hiking trail in Switzerland is a 12-stage 165 km long-distance hiking trail along the entire length of the Engadine high alpine valley in the eastern canton of Graubunden. For several years I have wanted to hike the entire trail, but have only managed six stages (and never more than two stages on consecutive days).

This summer I plan to finally hike the entire trail. I will do it in two sections: four stages in mid-June over the Corpus Christi long holiday weekend, and the remaining eight stages either in July or August.

For the first four stages I will spend three nights in Silvaplana (my destination after the first stage). It might be more fun to spend each night in a different hostel as near as possible to the stage endpoints, but I have a few reasons for staying in Silvaplana:

  1. I was too busy/lazy to book three different places.
  2. I really like Pappa Lou restaurant on the lake in Silvaplana and won't mind eating there every night.
  3. When you stay more than two nights in the same place, you receive a regional travel card that also works for the mountain railways. I would really like to go up from Corvatsch one day after I've hiked my stage to visit Fuorcla Surlej.

I bought a new lightweight rain jacket (I've worn my previous one until it's rotting away), new trekking poles (I slipped and bent my old ones several years ago), and a pair of field binoculars, and I resoled my hiking boots. I'm really looking forward to this.

item.title: Aluminum Xmas Tree
item.description:
Last Saturday we mounted our vintage 1950's Evergleam aluminum Christmas tree. Two years ago we upgraded to Hue smart string lights, but last January when we were taking down the tree, I decided to co-opt the string lights to provide mood lighting for my office (the Hue string lights are far too expensive to use only one month a year). Come December I was reluctant to part with my office mood lighting, so I ordered another set of string lights. Let's see if the process repeats itself next January.

I couldn't decide which color photo I liked better, so I decided to post both.

item.title: Umbrella
item.description:
Yesterday was a rainy day, so naturally when I went out in the morning for coffee and errands, I brought my umbrella. However, when I emerged from my favorite coffee shop, my umbrella was missing from the stand out front where I had left it. There was a similar umbrella in a slightly different color, so I hoped that someone had merely taken my umbrella by accident. I don't want the village I live in to be the kind of place where I have to worry about people stealing my shit.

This morning when I went out for coffee, my umbrella had been returned. Faith in humanity reaffirmed (or at least faith in my fellow residents of this mid-sized Swiss village).
